snippet.textDisplay: Thank you for your information videos when covid hit home we were not prepared for it we practice prevention but we really spent most of our time working and didn't know anything about the virus my son got scared he had symptoms that were pretty bad when he went to the hospital he was actually just a few days almost covid free but he was scared going to the Banner hospital emergency room where they told him he had pneumonia prescribed him antibiotics and prednisone by the third day of taking the meds I had to call 911 they hospitalized them intubated him and he died and I had no idea what happened but I had to find answers so I went to the hospital information portal where I clearly saw her that he had been given a wrong diagnosis the report said that he was 40 years old no underlying conditions all his vitals were good the doctor that checked his lungs at the lungs were clear and the X-ray said inconclusive yet the last doctor that released them saw covid automatically said ammonia prescribing the meds which lowered his immune system and cost the covid to take over she did not look at the full report she was too much of in a hurry to get him out and did not realize that what she saw was the residual effects of colvin he was like one or two days away from being covered free that it would have been better for her to give him some coit information send them home tell him to follow up with his primary care physician I'm sure this has happened in other places now I do my research I don't trust hospitals I don't trust a vaccine and I miss my son dearly but all I can do is warn people because the lawyers will not touch over cases warn people this is all based on fear stay safe
snippet.textOriginal: Thank you for your information videos when covid hit home we were not prepared for it we practice prevention but we really spent most of our time working and didn't know anything about the virus my son got scared he had symptoms that were pretty bad when he went to the hospital he was actually just a few days almost covid free but he was scared going to the Banner hospital emergency room where they told him he had pneumonia prescribed him antibiotics and prednisone by the third day of taking the meds I had to call 911 they hospitalized them intubated him and he died and I had no idea what happened but I had to find answers so I went to the hospital information portal where I clearly saw her that he had been given a wrong diagnosis the report said that he was 40 years old no underlying conditions all his vitals were good the doctor that checked his lungs at the lungs were clear and the X-ray said inconclusive yet the last doctor that released them saw covid automatically said ammonia prescribing the meds which lowered his immune system and cost the covid to take over she did not look at the full report she was too much of in a hurry to get him out and did not realize that what she saw was the residual effects of colvin he was like one or two days away from being covered free that it would have been better for her to give him some coit information send them home tell him to follow up with his primary care physician I'm sure this has happened in other places now I do my research I don't trust hospitals I don't trust a vaccine and I miss my son dearly but all I can do is warn people because the lawyers will not touch over cases warn people this is all based on fear stay safe
